intro: Leptospermum luehmannii, commonly known as the Luehmann’s tea tree, is a shrub native to Australia, particularly found in the south-western region of Western Australia. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Leptospermum luehmannii is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal practices.
